pullRequest.title: Refactor Search Page Components.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description

Motivation and Context


Before this PR, the different search page components were reimplementing view loading and loading/execution hook processing on their own, with slight differences and inconsistencies. Also setup of contexts was done per page component. This is a scenario that could easily introduce bugs when a change is done in one component but forgotten in others.
This PR is attempting to simplify the page components, by:

Turning them into functional components (not simplifying per se, but allows us to use hooks)
Introduce hooks for view creation, loading and hooks processing
Use hooks in all components
Consolidate contexts in single component

Fixes #8820.
How Has This Been Tested?



Manual testing of:

Creating a new search

Testing if change of search parameters update URL
Loading new search with changed URL parameters
Resetting a search


Creating a new search through streams page

Testing if change of search parameters update URL
Loading new search with changed URL parameters
Resetting a search


Loading a saved search

Testing if change of search parameters update URL
Loading a saved search with changed URL parameters


Creating a new dashboard
Loading a saved dashboard

Screenshots (if appropriate):
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Refactoring (non-breaking change)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

Checklist:



 My code follows the code style of this project.
 My change requires a change to the documentation.
 I have updated the documentation accordingly.
 I have read the CONTRIBUTING document.
 I have added tests to cover my changes.

/jenkins-pr-deps Graylog2/graylog-plugin-enterprise#1792

nodes.bodyText:
There is still a history.push in SavedSearchControls:162 which does the same and is no longer needed. I found it because I got the warning Saving view failed: TypeError: Cannot read property 'then' of undefined after creating a new saved search.
loadView returned a Promise before these changes, but I could not find another case where this could be a problem.
It was a little bit confusing, that the SavedSearchPage component is being used for the NewSearchPage and StreamSearchPage what about the name SearchPage?
When I reset a saved search, I get redirected to /search/new.

For the ShowViewPage, which is being used for saved dashboards, we are using the SavedSearchPage.
I am wondering if we should implement the SavedSearchPage for this component as well.
We do not need the ViewLoaderContext and NewViewLoaderContext, but we would use IfUserHasAccessToAnyStream here as well. Or am I missing a reason why we should not use IfUserHasAccessToAnyStream here?

Having a look at the code I had the following idea. This is a summary of all suggestions. We could:

rename this component to SearchPage
implement the SearchPage for the NewDashboardPage. In this case we would use the SearchPage for every search page. A side effect would be, that the ExtendedSearchPage is only being used inside the SearchPage.
rename ExtendedSearchPage to e.g. just Search and move it from pages to components/search

This way the relation between the search pages and the search would be easier to understand, imo.

beforeCommit.message: Leaving in guard to support test.

commit.message:
Avoid unnecessary search execution when starting/loading search.

Before this change, starting a new or loading an existing search
triggered a search job execution at least twice. This leads to
unnecessary load and might even be the cause for bugs which are hard to
reproduce (#8820).

This change is removing two unneeded search executions during mount.
Both are factually unneeded, as the initial search execution after
loading the saved search is performed in `_refreshIfNotUndeclared`.
Removing unneeded import, fixing linter hint.
Replacing search page component view loading logic with custom hooks.
Fix view creation for stream search page.
Extract new saved search creation to `useCreateSavedSearch` hook.
Memoize plugin store result to avoid rerendering.
Extracting common contexts to shared component.
Reinit loaded/hookComponent states, do not depend on query.
Fixing "Reset search" across normal and stream search.
Adjusting tests to changes and simplifying them.
Disabling linter hint, as we do want to execute the effect only once.
Disabling linter hints, as we do not want to take `query` changes into account.

Revert "Disabling linter hint, as we do want to execute the effect only once."

This reverts commit a3fd93406a67b9345d501c76ada898d6dc520990.
Pulling out destructuring, adding actual state element to dependencies.
Removing unused type and unneeded guard/FlowFixMe.
Leaving in guard to support test.
Close modal before redirecting, remove duplicate redirect.
User needs at least one stream now.

beforeCommit.message: User needs at least one stream now.

afterCommit.message: User needs at least one stream now.
